components.description:
A yellow face with a half-frown and white bandage wrapped around its head, often depicted partially over one eye. May represent physical injury or pain but also emotional hurting, sometimes for ironic effect.

Differs from other smileys conveying illness, such as ðŸ¤¢ Nauseated Face (appearing as if it’s going to vomit) or ðŸ¤’ Face With Thermometer (used especially for colds and flus).

Huawei's design for this emoji has a heavily bruised eye as well as a head bandage.
components.title: Face with Head-Bandage

description:
A yellow face with a half-frown and white bandage wrapped around its head, often depicted partially over one eye. May represent physical injury or pain but also emotional hurting, sometimes for ironic effect.

Differs from other smileys conveying illness, such as ðŸ¤¢ Nauseated Face (appearing as if it’s going to vomit) or ðŸ¤’ Face With Thermometer (used especially for colds and flus).

Huawei's design for this emoji has a heavily bruised eye as well as a head bandage.
title: Face with Head-Bandage

version.description: The Unicode Consortium has approved the following 41 emoji characters as part of Unicode 8.0, released on June 17, 2015. This is comprised of 37 new emojis, plus five emoji modifiers. Find out more about this update on the Emojipedia Blog.

emoji_net_data.category: Supplemental Symbols And Pictographs -> Emoticon faces
emoji_net_data.definition: A face showing a bandage wrapped around the head. Used to show someone who has been injured. Differs from the face with thermometer, which i http://emojipedia.org/face-with-head-bandage/
emoji_net_data.name: face with head-bandage

bn:00104411a: Suffering from physical injury especially that suffered in battle

bn:00099911a: Lacking grace in movement or posture
Awkward, lacking coordination, not graceful, not dextrous.
Lacking coordination in movement or action.
Awkward, lacking coordination, not graceful, not dextrous
Awkward, ungainly; lacking grace or dexterity in movement

bn:00083071v: To cover, as with a bandage.
Wrap around with something so as to cover or enclose

bn:00089751v: Cause injuries or bodily harm to
To cause physical harm to a living creature.
To wound or cause physical harm to a living creature.
To wound or cause physical harm.

bn:00089535v: To physically feel a damage, a pain, a disease or a punishment.
Feel pain or be in pain

bn:00043011n: Harm is a moral and legal concept encompassing anything that causes injury, damage, or loss.
Harm is a moral and legal concept.
Any serious injury to the body, often resulting from violence or an accident.
Any physical damage to the body caused by violence or accident or fracture etc.
Damage to the body of a human or animal

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00043013n: Major trauma is injury that can potentially lead to serious outcomes.
Physiological wound caused by an external source
Destructiveness that causes harm or injury

bn:00008296n: A bandage is a piece of material used either to support a medical device such as a dressing or splint, or on its own to provide support to the body; it can also be used to restrict a part of the body.
Medicine: piece of material used to cover a wound.
A piece of soft material that covers and protects an injured part of the body
A piece of material used to cover a wound.
A strip of gauze or similar material used to protect or support a wound or injury.
Any therapeutic material that is used to cover an injury.
Piece of material used either to support a medical device such as a dressing or splint

bn:00045285n: The condition of someone who suffers; a state of pain or distress.
Suffering is an individual's basic affective experience of physical or mental unpleasantness and aversion associated with harm or threat of harm.
An emotional or psychological hurt (humiliation or bad experience)
Suffering, or pain in a broad sense, may be described as an experience of unpleasantness and aversion associated with the perception of harm or threat of harm in an individual.
Relating to physical or mental suffering
Feelings of mental or physical pain
Pain, mental, or emotional unhappiness caused by bad things happening
